summary.para: Raises each element of InputTensor to the power of Exponent, placing the result into the corresponding element of OutputTensor.
Negative bases are supported for integral exponents, otherwise this operator returns NaN.
This operator supports in-place execution, meaning that OutputTensor is permitted to alias InputTensor during binding.

member.name: DML_ELEMENT_WISE_CONSTANT_POW_OPERATOR_DESC.InputTensor
member.summary: The input tensor to read from.

member.name: DML_ELEMENT_WISE_CONSTANT_POW_OPERATOR_DESC.OutputTensor
member.summary: The output tensor to write the results to.

member.name: DML_ELEMENT_WISE_CONSTANT_POW_OPERATOR_DESC.ScaleBias
member.summary: An optional scale and bias to apply to the input. If present, this has the effect of applying the function g(x) = x * scale + bias to each input element prior to computing this operator.

member.name: DML_ELEMENT_WISE_CONSTANT_POW_OPERATOR_DESC.Exponent
member.summary: The exponent that all inputs will be raised to.
